questions.text: When preparing a representative sample from a list of 280 customers who complained about errors in their statements, a _____ might select every tenth customer for review.
questions.explanation: A systematic sample selects every nth record or person from a list to ensure even distribution.

questions.text: Identify a typical example of a system requirement for the input category.
options: As a final step in year-end processing, the payroll system must update employee salaries, bonuses, and benefits.
Response time must not exceed four seconds.
The system must provide logon security at the operating system level and at the application level.
Student grades must be entered on machine-readable forms prepared by the instructor.
questions.correctAnswer: Student grades must be entered on machine-readable forms prepared by the instructor.
questions.explanation: Input requirements define how data enters a system; in this case, via machine-readable forms.

questions.text: A(n) _____ is a characteristic or feature that must be included in an information system to satisfy business needs and be acceptable to users.
questions.explanation: A system requirement defines necessary features, functions, and constraints for the system.

questions.text: _____ means that a project can be implemented in an acceptable time frame.
questions.explanation: Schedule feasibility checks if the project can be completed within the required time limits.

questions.text: When studying an information system, illustrations of actual documents should be collected using a process called _____.
questions.explanation: Sampling involves selecting representative examples of documents or data for study.

questions.text: _____ design and construct webpages, monitor traffic, manage hardware and software, and link web-based applications to a company's information systems.
questions.explanation: Web support specialists build and maintain websites and ensure integration with company systems.

questions.text: _____ limitations result when a system designed for a specific hardware configuration becomes obsolete when new hardware is introduced.
questions.explanation: Performance limitations occur when outdated hardware cannot efficiently support system operations.

questions.text: _____ includes ongoing support and maintenance costs, as well as acquisition costs.
questions.explanation: Total cost of ownership covers all expenses throughout a system’s lifecycle, including maintenance.

questions.text: In an interview, _____ limit the responses.
questions.explanation: Closed-ended questions restrict answers to fixed choices for easier data comparison.

questions.text: Which one of the following is a method of developing systems that is well suited to traditional project management tools and techniques?
questions.explanation: Structured analysis follows linear, sequential steps and aligns well with traditional project control.

questions.text: Many hardware and software companies offer _____ for IT professionals, which verifies that an individual demonstrated a certain level of knowledge and skill on a standardised test.
questions.explanation: Certification demonstrates verified technical competence in a specific technology or methodology.

questions.text: Which of the following is one of the main sectors of e-commerce?
questions.explanation: B2C e-commerce involves businesses selling products or services directly to consumers online.

questions.text: Structured analysis is called a(n) _____ technique because it focuses on processes that transform data into useful information.
questions.explanation: Structured analysis emphasizes process flows and data transformation rather than object structures.

questions.text: Agile methods typically use a(n) _____, which represents a series of iterations based on user feedback.
questions.explanation: The spiral model is iterative, allowing repeated refinement through user feedback and prototyping.

questions.text: A _____ describes the information that a system must provide.
questions.explanation: A data model defines the information structure and relationships within the system.

questions.text: _____ controls the flow of data, provides data security, and manages network operations.
questions.explanation: System software manages hardware, software, and communication to ensure smooth operations.

questions.text: A _____ graphically displays one or more business processes, such as handling an airline reservation, filling a product order, or updating a customer account.
questions.explanation: A BPM visually represents workflows to help understand and optimise business processes.

questions.text: A(n) _____ is the set of beliefs, rules, traditions, values, and attitudes that define a company and influence its way of doing business.
questions.explanation: Corporate culture reflects shared values and behaviors that shape how an organization operates.

questions.text: In a data flow diagram (DFD), the Gane and Sarson symbol for a data store is a _____.
options: line with a single or double arrowhead
flat rectangle that is open on the right side and closed on the left side
rectangle, which may be shaded to make it look three-dimensional
questions.correctAnswer: flat rectangle that is open on the right side and closed on the left side
questions.explanation: In a Gane and Sarson DFD, data stores are shown as open-ended rectangles representing data repositories.

questions.text: The _____ is a top-down representation of a process.
questions.explanation: FDDs show processes broken down hierarchically into smaller components.

questions.text: Which of the following methods of system development stresses intense team-based effort and reflects a set of community-based values?
questions.explanation: Agile methods rely on collaboration, adaptability, and iterative development with continuous feedback.

questions.text: A _____ shows a logical structure, with all possible combinations of conditions and resulting actions.
questions.explanation: Decision tables map conditions to possible actions, clarifying complex decision logic.

questions.text: The objective of a _____ is to use the combined judgment and experience of several analysts to evaluate system projects.
questions.explanation: A computer resources or systems review committee evaluates and prioritizes proposed system projects.

questions.text: In a(n) _____ structure, which is usually based on interpersonal relationships, some people have more influence or knowledge than appears on an organization chart.
questions.explanation: Informal structures rely on personal relationships rather than formal authority.

questions.text: Projects where management has no choice in implementing them are called _____ projects.
questions.explanation: Nondiscretionary projects are mandatory due to legal, operational, or external requirements.

questions.text: Structured English might look familiar to programming students because it resembles _____, which is used in program design.
questions.explanation: Structured English combines English with programming logic similar to pseudocode for clarity.

questions.text: Greater user involvement in the system development process usually results in _____.
questions.explanation: User participation improves accuracy, satisfaction, and system acceptance.

questions.text: Projects that have adapted an _____ methodology are prone to rapid changes throughout the system development life cycle.
questions.explanation: Agile development embraces flexibility and continuous adaptation to change.
